inspection.message: Link from "%1" to article "%2" that is outside of current build.
Link from "%1" to article "%2" that does not exist.
Trying to rel from one side block to another via "%1"
Shortcut key "%1" has no mapping in current keymap.
Cannot include element with include-id "%1" from article "%2" to article "%3" because it cannot be found.
Hard-coded shortcut "%1".
Attempt to include "%1" from article "%2" to %3 yields empty content.
Include-id "%1" matches nothing in "%2".
Image "%1" cannot be found.
Link to "%1" in "%2" uses anchor "%3" that does not exist.
Include-id "%1" matches more than one fragment in "%2".
At least one topic file must be included in build. Possibly "%1.tree" is corrupted.
"%1" is included in build, but cannot be found.
"%1" exists, but is not a valid XML file.
Element id "%1" occurs %2 times instead of 1.
Color "%1" does not exist, defaulting to #000000.
Bad web-path syntax on %1 in project.ihp
Toc element "%1" cannot have both anchor and content-based children.
Toc element "%1%2" cannot display content-based children because it already points to one of them.
Toc element "%1" content-based children nesting %2 exceeds recommended max of 3.
Wrapper toc element "%1" cannot have accepts-web-file-names attribute because it does not produce any content.
Wrapper toc element "%1" cannot have custom-auxiliary-id attribute because it does not produce any content.
Duplicate toc item id "%1" while processing element "%2"
Toc element "%1" toc-title matches its default title, "%2"
More than 7 content-based children "%1" at level %2.
Toc element "%1" custom-title matches its default title, "%2"
Toc element "%1" toc-title matches its custom-title, "%2"
Wrapper toc element "%1" toc-title matches its custom-title, "%2"
Wrapper toc element "%1" cannot have custom-web-file-name attribute because it does not produce any content.
Wrapper toc element "%1" cannot have accepts-web-file-names-ref attribute because it does not produce any content.
Accepted file name "%1" on "%2" must include .html extension.
Semicolon cannot be used as delimiter in accepts-web-file-names on toc element "%1"
"%1" on topic "%2" points to article built from "%3", and cannot be used in accepts-web-file-names.
Cannot include "%1" because it doesn't exist.
Cannot include "%1" because it is corrupted.
include-id "%1" does not exist in "%2".
ref "%1" on "%2" points to a rule that does not exist.
Toc element "%1" cannot have both accepts-web-file-names and accepts-web-file-names-ref attributes.
Toc element "%1" custom web file name must not include extension.
Article for toc element "%1" has no content elements matching "%2"
Redirection target "%1" appears on too many toc elements (%2): %3.
Duplicate toc item id "%1" while processing element "%2" from "%3"
Toc element "%1" is not unique, occurs %2 times.
